bug.description:
I see the following error when I use multi-thread pipe + serialization. In <denchmark-link:https://spacy.io/usage/spacy-101#lightning-tour-serialization>spaCy 101</denchmark-link> it feeds a string for saving path but it doesn't work with me. <denchmark-code>--------------------------------------------------------------------------- AttributeError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-5-24d78de5446f> in <module>() 4 for i, doc in enumerate(nlp.pipe(texts, batch_size=100, n_threads=4)): 5 fpath = os.path.join('./spacy/', '{}.spacy'.format(i)) ----> 6 doc.to_disk(fpath)
doc.pyx in spacy.tokens.doc.Doc.to_disk()
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'open' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Info about spaCy</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.0.2 Platform: Windows-10-10.0.17025-SP0 Python version: 3.5.3

comments.comment: Thanks for the report – this was an error in v2.0.2 (see <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/1521>#1521</denchmark-link> ) ans has since been fixed in v2.0.3. So simply updating spaCy to the latest version should do the trick: pip install -U spacy Btw, if you're using conda, note that the latest version is not available via conda-forge just yet. Unfortunately, the conda builds always take a little longer – but it'll be there asap (as soon as the build is fixed an all tests pass).
